title: Calories in Cooked Cabbage
meta_description: Discover calories in cooked cabbage per 100 g, including carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Boiled or steamed cabbage, drained, no added salt, fat, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cabbage variety, cooking method, added ingredients, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked cabbage provides about 23 kcal and 2.2 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Saut√©ed with 1 tsp butter per 100 g
Stir-fried with 1 tsp oil per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g cooked cabbage?
faqs.a: Approximately 23 kcal for boiled or steamed cabbage without additions.

faqs.q: Is cooked cabbage low in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, about 5.5 g carbs per 100 g, with 2.2 g fiber.
Slightly; cooked has ~23 kcal per 100 g vs. ~25 kcal raw, but methods like frying add calories.

faqs.q: What about protein in cooked cabbage?
faqs.a: Roughly 1.3 g protein per 100 g, making it a low-protein veggie.

faqs.q: How does added butter affect calories in cooked cabbage?
faqs.a: Adding 1 tsp butter per 100 g increases calories by ~36 to about 59 kcal.
